content.webTitle: Saturday Sundae: there's little Roberto Mancini isn't angry about

fields.headline: Saturday Sundae: there's little Roberto Mancini isn't angry about
fields.bodyText: MAN OF THE DAY Everton's Seamus Coleman: stifled £130m of Man City midfield and forward talent. He cost £60,000 from Sligo Rovers. QUOTE OF THE DAY David Platt, deputising in the post-match interviews, with Roberto Mancini too angry to talk to the press. What was he so angry about? "Everything in general." GOAL OF THE DAY A Roy of the Rovers classic at Celtic: Georgios Samaras scoring an overhead last-gasp winner to beat Aberdeen 4-3. MOST INEVITABLE RESULT Liverpool's 3-1 defeat at Southampton – coming days after Steven Gerrard rallied his side for a "perfect finish" to the season. MOST RELIEVED Wolves' David Davis, scorer of the day's most grizzly own goal. Two second-half Wolves goals eased his misery. MINUTE OF THE DAY Colchester's 29th: the minute in which they turned a 1-0 deficit at Bury into a 2-1 win, with two goals in 48 seconds. PICTURE OF THE DAY Modern football's version of the 1950s rattle: Stoke fans greeting their team pre-match.
